library.description: animate.css is a bunch of cool, fun, and cross-browser animations for you to use in your projects. Great for emphasis, home pages, sliders, and general just-add-water-awesomeness.
library.name: animate.css

library.description:
Javascript Tweening Engine

Super simple, fast and easy to use tweening engine which incorporates optimised Robert Penner's equations.
library.name: tween.js

library.description:
A powerful little tool for managing CSS animations

Stack animations, create cross-browser blurring, set callbacks on animation completion, make magic.
library.name: animo.js

library.description: Textillate.js combines some awesome libraries to provide an ease-to-use plugin for applying CSS3 animations to any text.
library.name: Textillate

library.description: CSS animations with a soul. With Anima it's easy to animate over a hundred objects at a time. And it's only 5k when gzipped.
library.name: Anima

library.description:
CAAT: Canvas Advanced Animation Tookit
CAAT is a director-based Scene graph manager.

It is able to render using Canvas, WebGL and CSS without making changes to the applications that sit on top of it.
library.name: CAAT

library.description:
Shifty is a tweening engine built in JavaScript.  It is designed to fit any number of tweening needs. Features include:

Speed - Shifty is optimized for performance.
Works well as the base function in a prototype chain.
Modular, extensible architecture allows you to use only the Shifty components you need.
Small download: Full library (with all extensions) is about 3K minified and gzipped
library.name: Shifty

library.description:
Rekapi is a keyframe animation library for JavaScript. It gives you:

A keyframe-based Model by which to structure an animation
Controller APIs to control the playback of an animation


Rekapi does not define drawing methods. That part is completely generic, and the library exposes a common interface for defining Views.
library.name: Rekapi

library.description:
Stand-alone CSS animation JavaScript mini-framework

Doesn't need a JavaScript framework
Full set of CSS properties for animation (length-based and colors)
Easing and callbacks
Less than 50 lines of code
library.name: emile

library.description: AliceJS - (A Lightweight Independent CSS Engine) is a micro JavaScript library focused on using hardware-accelerated capabilities (in particular CSS3 features) in modern browsers for generating high-quality, high-end visual effects.
library.name: AliceJS

library.description: Firmin is a JavaScript animation library that uses CSS transforms and transitions to create smooth, hardware-accelerated animations.
library.name: Firmin

library.description: Janis is a lightweight Javascript framework that provides simple animations via CSS transitions for modern browsers on the web as well as mobile devices. It is not designed to solve everyone's problems--it's simply designed to organize commonly used methods of animating DOM elements in Javascript. It is released under the MIT license and is free to re-use or modify in any way as long as you keep the copyright notice in the file.
library.name: Janis

library.description: With the color animation jQuery-plugin, you can animate colors of any element. Like text color, background color and border color. It supports rgba colors for transparent colors.
library.name: Color Animation jQuery Plugin

library.description: With this jQuery plugin, you can extend the animate function to support the CSS box shadow-property. You can animate the color, the x- and y-offset, the blur-radius and spread-radius.
library.name: Shadow animation jQuery plugin

library.description: Declarative handling library for CSS animations. The main objective is to provide an elocuent, easy to translate, and quick to develop environment.
library.name: AniJS

library.description:
GreenSock Animation Platform (GSAP) v12
Version 12 not only brings more tweenable goodness than ever to Flash, but for the first time ever it does the same for JavaScript too. That’s right. You can use the same animation toolset for your Flash and HTML5 projects. Same API, same user-friendliness, and the same focus on performance and a robust feature set. If you’re a Flash developer, this destroys one of the barriers keeping you from feeling comfortable with HTML5. If you’re a JavaScript developer, this should make advanced animation tasks much simpler and more performant. In fact, it could revolutionize your animation workflow.
library.name: GSAP12

library.description: animation library that is much faster than JQuery and most other libraries
library.name: Bounce.js

library.description: Javascript sprite library for HTML5 Canvas similar to FLASH/ActionScript3.
library.name: CanvasScript3

library.description: A javascript vector animation engine for the HTML5 Canvas supporting SVGs, Blender3D objects, timelines, easing, command chanining and callbacks.
library.name: Burst

library.description:
Keanu is a micro-lib for animation on Canvas/JS.

Currently being used on ESPN.com Gamecast (MLB, Basketball)
library.name: Keanu

library.description: Animate.css custom binding for Knockout.js
library.name: knockout.animate

library.description: A 12kb animation, physics and input tracking library.
library.name: Popmotion

library.description: It’s time to add some creativity to good old pull to refresh view. You can now literally launch your feed content or search results like a firework! Entertain your app users while they are waiting for refreshment — it’s easy with Fireworky Pull To Refresh library for Android apps.
library.name: FireworkyPullToRefresh

library.description: You don’t want your apps look and feel boring, do you? Add some bubbles! Bubble Animation Layout for Android by Cleveroad is at your service. This component is extremely functional and suits all kinds of apps. It’s more than simple to get your app’s UI stand out and attract attention.
library.name: BubbleAnimationLayout

library.description: TrueJodi is the best christian matrimony website for christian brides and grooms.
library.name: Christian brides
